newsitem.title: FINLAND: Finnish Q1 oil products sales fall 6 pct yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: Finnish Q1 oil products sales fall 6 pct yr/yr.

text.p: Sales in Finland of oil products fell almost five percent year-on-year in March to some 700,000 tonnes, the Finnish Petroleum Association said in its monthly review received on Monday.
In Q1, sales were down six percent at 2.42 million tonnes.
Exceptionally warm weather in March caused a 7.5 percent fall in sales of domestic heating oil, and industrial heating oil sales fell 12 percent year-on-year in March.
Motor petroleum sales were steady year-on-year in March while diesel oil sales, which tend to closely track economic growth, increased 2.5 percent, the association said.

In January-March, diesel sales were up four percent year-on-year at 370,900 tonnes and motor petroleum sales increased five percent to 414,200 tonnes while domestic heating oil sales fell 16 percent to 577,100 tonnes and industrial heating oil sales fell 19 percent to 375,900 tonnes, it said.
